page.title: 07EDUCATION IN KIP VALLEY
page.content: Three schools provide{education. {Inverkip Primary}has 90 pupils. {Greenock High School}and{Glenburn}are together on one site to the South of the Braeside housing estate in Greenock. Greenock High School is a 6 year comprehensive secondary with 710 pupils in 1985 and Glenburn is a school for pupils with learning difficulties and has 60 pupils. Pupils attend Inverkip from the age of 5/12 years. then move to Greenock High School which also takes pupils from 6 other primary schools. All the schools are involved in many extracurricular activities such as sports{events}etc. Parents{attitudes}to education in this area vary at this time because of the introduction of Standard Grade courses and the withdrawel of corporal punishment which many fear has caused a drop in standards of discipline.
